result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:06 PM Defendant Samantha D Crain in court.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Samantha D Crain.  Prosecuting attorney Azucena C Guizar Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defense has received discovery but does not have an offer from the State. Indicates the defendant will be going into custody on an OWI case and will be incarcerated at the next hearing. Seeking to appear by ZOOM. 
BTC: Defendant may appear via ZOOM for the next hearing. Matter set over.

for deft from Sauk County Jail for Initial appearance on 5-10-22
State's Notice of Intent to introduce 911 recordings
State's Notice of Intent to introduce recorded Statements
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim A.H (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samantha D Crain appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Samantha D Crain. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
